column1: Rancho Peñasquitos is a suburban community in the northeastern part of the city of San Diego
column2: California. It is named after the first Mexican land grant in the county
column3: Rancho Santa Maria de Los Peñasquitos. Peñasquitos means "little cliffs" in Spanish. It abuts Los Peñasquitos Canyon Preserve
column4: an open space preserve that offers hiking
column6: and equestrian trails. The community is commonly abbreviated "PQ."

Rancho Peñasquitos is a car-dependent area
column2: according to WalkScore.com. Black Mountain Road is the main north-south artery
column3: and Carmel Mountain Road/Rancho Peñasquitos Boulevard is the main east-west artery. State Route 56 traverses east–west through the central portion of the community. Interstate 15 forms an eastern boundary of Rancho Peñasquitos
column4: with Carmel Mountain Ranch lying on the far side.

column1: The San Diego Metropolitan Transit System (MTS) operates a bus through the area
column3: with a stop on Carmel Mountain Road. The MTS Rapid #235 bus operates from the Sabre Springs/Peñasquitos Transit Station
column4: arriving in downtown San Diego after only 5 stops.

column1: Mt. Carmel Tournament of Bands is an annual high school marching band parade and field show competition
column2: fully volunteer-run by the Mt Carmel Music Foundation. It has been held in late October every year since 1976. It is the most widely attended parade and field competition in San Diego
column3: where more than 30 bands from San Diego county and the Los Angeles metropolitan area perform.

column1: The Fiesta de Los Penasquitos and Parade is on the first weekend in May
column2: held since 1995. PQ residents and community organizations partner to celebrate the city with a 5K Fun Run
column4: and Parade (as of 2015). a) The annual PQ5K Fun Run (since 2007) is a free event sponsored by the Peñasquitos Stake of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in partnership with the Peñasquitos Town Council. The event begins the Saturday before the Fiesta de los Peñasquitos. b) In 2015
column5: the Rancho Peñasquitos Town Council held its Inaugural Parade for the fiesta. The event is managed by Rancho Peñasquitos Town Council
column6: and is supported by a City of San Diego Arts & Culture Grant. http://www.rpcouncil.com/

column1: The Rancho Peñasquitos Recreation Council sponsors a fireworks show for July 4th at Westview High School; it is usually held on July 3. Funding was not available in 2019 for a fireworks show.

column2: since 1982 families on several local streets have installed increasingly elaborate displays and lights for the season. In addition
column3: some groups rent vehicles for touring and singing Christmas carols.

column1: Fire protection and emergency medical services are provided by the San Diego Fire-Rescue Department fire station #40 at 13393 Salmon River Road in the area of Rancho Peñasquitos. This station is in the 7th Battalion.
The San Diego Police Department operates from a station on 13396 Salmon River Road
